Intervention: INTERVENTION 1:
Health volunteers
• Healthy women will be tested for magnetic resonance contraindications (MRI) and then subjected to a contrasting injection and SWIFT acquisition.
• Magnetic resonance imaging: Healthy patients and volunteers will first be tested for MRI contraindications. The SWIFT MRI workflow will be performed as follows:
A line IV is placed by the nurse,
The patient is placed in the 4T MRI scanner at CMRR,
The first images of Scouts and the manual linear holds are adjusted,
The pre-contrast images of the weighted SWIFT T1 and the T1 card are obtained,
The continuous acquisition of SWIFT begins immediately before the contrast injection,
Injection contrasted,
The continuous acquisition of SWIFT continues for 12 minutes after the contrast,
• Late improvement images can also be obtained.
Foresight analysis, thresholds will be set. SWIFT-DCE diagnostic performance will be compared with previous FLASH-DCE methods.
INTERVENTION 2:
Patients with breast cancer

Patients with breast cancer who suspect a breast injury that will be biopsied will be detected for magnetic resonance contraindications (MRI), then subjected to a contrasting injection and the acquisition of SWIFT.
• Magnetic resonance imaging: Healthy patients and volunteers will first be tested for MRI contraindications. The SWIFT MRI workflow will be performed as follows:
A line IV is placed by the nurse,
The patient is placed in the 4T MRI scanner at CMRR,
The first images of Scouts and the manual linear holds are adjusted,
The pre-contrast images of the weighted SWIFT T1 and the T1 card are obtained,
The continuous acquisition of SWIFT begins immediately before the contrast injection,
Injection contrasted,
The continuous acquisition of SWIFT continues for 12 minutes after the contrast,
• Late improvement images can also be obtained.
10 and 30 patients will be scanned in the first and second years, respectively. Thresholds will be set for prospective analysis.
Eligibility: Women with a suspected breast mass identified clinically or mammographically that is likely to be biopsy or surgically eliminated.
History of rifle wounds and shrapnel
Main operations with ferromagnetic implant potential
i-STAT system, portable blood analyser creatinine test (I-STAT), estimated glomerular filtration rate (GFR) < 30
Metallic object (length greater than 2 cm) in the chest
- Metal ink tatoo less than 20 cm from the breast (about 8 inches)
Results: Performance measures:
Injuries
Number of lesions detected
Time: at the time of reading by two radiologists, compared to biopsy within 7 days.
